comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Ha! This is interesting. It is from the tall tower of Bernard Holterman's house, a favourite view for photographers. See background history and the famous 1875 Holtermann Panorama - nga.gov.au/Exhibition/PICTUREPARADISE/pdf/Holtermann.pdf There are many panoramas from here; it will be interesting to see if we can get a firm date for it. To start, the absence of the 1892 Hentsch's Bond (cnr Windmill and Kent St, Millers Point) suggests c.1890. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/] Do you have any more adjoining photos for a possible panorama?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Interesting to compare with this later Charles Kerry photo from the same place, but slightly to the left. It just shows the Hensch's Bond at full Zoomit - from.ph/27618 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2900852129/] PhM

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The Hotel Australia (see note) is there, opened in July 1891. So this photo has to be 1891. Somebody cleverer than me could probably work out the month from the angle and length of the shadows!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia/ What a fascinating man! Was just reading this blog on him over at SLNSW : Bernard Holterman
